page.title: 07Houses in Snape, Yorkshire
page.content: The village of Snape developed on either side of the village green with the beck running through the middle.It is a long village nearly one kilometre from the Castle to the last house. Houses in Snape are of different design but are mostly of sandstone.The old houses have very thick walls and most have roofs of red tiles.Many cottages have been renovated, but if you look carefully, you can see a few old,horizontally-sliding sash windows. Old photographs show some cottages with thatched roofs. Of 120 houses in the village,18 were built in the last 10 years.
